snippet: The failure of the United States to take more forceful action to help Ukraine leaves Japan concerned about whether Washington would aid it in a conflict with China.
abstract: Failure of the United States to take forceful action to protect Crimea from Russian annexation under the 1994 Budapest Memorandum has raised concerns among Japanese leaders; America's longstanding promise to protect Japan against hostile neighbors, meaning China and North Korea, will be closely examined during visit by Defense Sec Chuck Hagel.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MARTIN FACKLER

lead_paragraph: The failure of the United States to take more forceful action to help Ukraine leaves Japan concerned about whether Washington would aid it in a conflict with China.

headline.main: U.S. Response to Crimea Worries Japan’s Leaders
headline.print_headline: U.S. Response to Crimea Worries Japan’s Leaders
